pros: - Excellent training - Great employer/employee relationship - Consistently updating your skills - Usually working within a great team of people
cons: - Job can be very mentally and physically demanding.

pros: Starlight's culture is so supportive and positive - it's like nowhere else I've worked.  Everyone is encouraged to work to their strengths, and to grow them, so that you really do end up doing great work and the L&D opportunities are excellent. Everyone is completely aligned to our mission: we go to work every day because we want to make sick kids happy - there are different teams / divisions but everyone is on the same side .  Also I love that I can work flexibly, it really makes a big difference to my life.
cons: With no govt funding, we rely on the donated dollar - so you just do not see cash being splashed around like in a corporate environment.

pros: Starlight Children's Foundation is one of the best places I've ever worked at. They have such a friendly welcoming environment. You arrive and leave work with a smile on your face. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to even volunteer.
cons: The hiring process was a bit long and there are a lot of training modules to go through, but it is all for the benefit and safety of the kids and their program.

review_title: Make a difference in a high energy, forward thinking nonprofit!
pros:
> Powerful purpose - brightening the lives of seriously ill kids & their families. Every day has meaning.
> Focus on digital engagement, innovation, agility and growth
> Fast paced
> Collaborative environment
> Inspiring leadership
> NFP tax benefits
cons: > The push for growth is exciting, but not easy!

review_title: Really enjoyed my time with Starlight
job_title: Individual Giving Manager in St Leonards
pros: Positive culture, friendly, professional and lovely people
cons: There weren’t any notable downsides during my time at Starlight
